intro: Cathissa reverchonii, commonly known as the Madagascar cissus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Vitaceae, which includes grapes and other climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Cathissa reverchonii is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range.
